sen.j: 藤牧 義夫（ふじまき よしお、1911年1月19日 - 1935年9月2日失踪）は、群馬県館林市出身の版画家。
sen.e: Yoshio FUJIMAKI (January 19, 1911 - disappeared on September 2, 1935) was a woodblock artist came from Tatebayashi City in Gunma Prefecture.
Yoshio FUJIMAKI (January 19, 1911 - disappeared on September 2, 1935) was a woodblock artist came from Tatebayashi City in Gunma Prefecture.
Yoshio FUJIMAKI (January 19, 1911 - disappeared on September 2, 1935) was a woodblock artist came from Tatebayashi City in Gunma Prefecture.

sen.j: 日用雑貨小売を営む自宅の二軒隣りに、七歳年上の藤野天光（天光）が住んでいた。
sen.e: His family ran a convenience goods store at their house, and Tenko FUJINO (written as 藤野隆秋 (or 天光)), who was seven years senior to Yoshio FUJIMAKI, lived in the two doors away from there.
His family ran a convenience goods store at their house, and Tenko FUJINO (written as 藤野隆秋 (or 天光)), who was seven years senior to Yoshio FUJIMAKI, lived two doors away from there.
His family ran a convenience goods store at their house, and Tenko FUJINO, who was seven years senior to Yoshio FUJIMAKI, lived two doors away from there.
sen.cmt: (written as 藤野隆秋 (or 天光))の表記は不要と考え削除しました。

sen.j: 父は永年教職にあり、小学校長も歴任し、「三岳」と号し絵や書をよくした。
sen.e: His father had been a teacher for a long time, also successively filled the post of elementary school principal, and good at drawing pictures and calligraphy by the name of 'Sangaku'.
His father had been a teacher for a long time, also successively filled the post of elementary school principal, and was accomplished at drawing pictures and calligraphy under the name of 'Sangaku'.
His father had been a teacher for a long time, also successively filled the post of elementary school principal, and was accomplished at drawing pictures and calligraphy under the name of 'Sangaku.'
sen.cmt: ピリオドの位置を訂正しました。

sen.j: 小学校時代から美術が得意で周囲を驚かせた。
sen.e: Since he was in the elementary school, he did so well in Art that surprised those around him.
Since he was in the elementary school, he did so well in Art that it surprised those around him.
Since he was in the elementary school, he did so well in Art that it surprised those around him.

sen.j: 上京後商業図案などを学ぶかたわら、ドイツ表現主義の影響を受けつつ独自の版画様式を確立。
sen.e: When he was in Tokyo, he studied commercial designs and the like, while established a unique woodblock style under the influence of German expressionism.
When he was in Tokyo, he studied commercial designs and the like, while established a unique woodblock style under the influence of German expressionism.
When he was in Tokyo, he studied commercial designs and the like, while established a unique woodblock style under the influence of German expressionism.

sen.j: 全4巻・全長60メートルに及ぶ「隅田川絵巻」はその代表的作品。
sen.e: The 'picture scroll of the Sumida River' is one of his most important works with total length of the whole four volumes is 60 meters.
The 'picture scroll of the Sumida River' is one of his most important works and the total length of the whole four volumes is 60 meters.
The 'picture scroll of the Sumida River' is one of his most important works and the total length of the whole four volumes is 60 meters.

sen.j: 24歳のとき東京で失踪。
sen.e: He disappeared in Tokyo at the age of 24.
He disappeared in Tokyo at the age of 24.
He disappeared in Tokyo at the age of 24.

sen.j: 墓は館林市朝日町法輪寺。
sen.e: His grave is in the Horin-ji Temple in Asahi-cho, Tatebayashi City.
His grave is in the Horin-ji Temple in Asahi-cho, Tatebayashi City.
His grave is in the Horin-ji Temple in Asahi-cho, Tatebayashi City.

sen.j: 1911年（明治44年） 1月19日、群馬県邑楽郡館林町1006番地（現館林市城町）に、父巳之七、母たかの末子（4男）として生まれる
sen.e: On January, 19, 1911, he was born as the youngest son (fourth son) to the father Minoshichi and mother Taka at the address of 1006, Tatebayashi-cho, Oura County, Gunma Prefecture (present Shiromachi in Tatebayashi City).

On January, 19, 1911, he was born as the youngest son (fourth son) to the father Minoshichi and mother Taka at the address of 1006, Tatebayashi-cho, Oura County, Gunma Prefecture (present Shiromachi in Tatebayashi City).

On January, 19, 1911, he was born as the youngest son (fourth son) to the father Minoshichi and mother Taka at the address of 1006, Tatebayashi-cho, Oura County, Gunma Prefecture (present Shiromachi in Tatebayashi City).

sen.j: 1913年（大正2年） 母たか亡くなる
sen.e: In 1913, his mother Taka died.
In 1913, his mother Taka died.
In 1913, his mother Taka died.

sen.j: 1917年（大正6年） 館林市立第一小学校に入学
sen.e: In 1917, he entered Tatebayashi City Dai-ichi (first) elementary school.
In 1917, he entered Tatebayashi City Dai-ichi (first) elementary school.
In 1917, he entered Tatebayashi City Dai-ichi (first) elementary school.

sen.j: 1919年（大正8年） 父、亡母たかの実妹まさと再婚
sen.e: In 1919, his father remarried Masa, his mother's real younger sister.
In 1919, his father remarried Masa, his mother's real younger sister.
In 1919, his father remarried Masa, his mother's real younger sister.

sen.j: 1923年（大正12年） 小学校尋常科を卒業
sen.e: In 1923, he graduated from the elementary school course.
In 1923, he graduated from the elementary school course.
In 1923, he graduated from the elementary school course.

sen.j: 1925年（大正14年） 高等科を卒業、9月、父亡くなる
sen.e: In 1925, he graduated from the advanced course, and in September, his father died.
In 1925, he graduated from the advanced course, and in September, his father died.
In 1925, he graduated from the advanced course, and in September, his father died.

sen.j: 1926年（大正15年） 東京に嫁いだ姉を頼って上京。
sen.e: In 1926, he came up to Tokyo, counting on his elder sister who had married and lived there.
In 1926, he came up to Tokyo, counting on his elder sister who had married and lived there.
In 1926, he came up to Tokyo, counting on his elder sister who had married and lived there.

sen.j: 上野図書館に通い商業図案などを学ぶ。
sen.e: He frequently visited the Ueno Library and studied commercial designs and the like.
He frequently visited the Ueno Library and studied commercial designs and the like.
He frequently visited the Ueno Library and studied commercial designs and the like.

sen.j: 父の伝記を書いた自家製本「三岳全集第１巻」を完成
sen.e: He completed the self bound book 'the complete works of Sangaku: Vol. 1' in which he wrote his father's biography.
He completed the self bound book 'the complete works of Sangaku: Vol. 1' in which he wrote his father's biography.
He completed the self bound book 'the complete works of Sangaku: Vol. 1' in which he wrote his father's biography.

sen.j: 1928年 銀座の植松図案工房に就職
sen.e: In 1928, he was employed at the Uematsu design studio in Ginza.
In 1928, he was employed at the Uematsu design studio in Ginza.
In 1928, he was employed at the Uematsu design studio in Ginza.

sen.j: 1931年（昭和6年） 第9回春陽会展に「ガード下のスパーク」（木版）を出品、
sen.e: In 1931, he submitted 'Gado-shita no supaku (spark under a railroad bridge)' (wood-block printing) to the ninth Exhibition of Shunyokai.
In 1931, he submitted 'Gado-shita no supaku (spark under a railroad bridge)' (wood-block printing) to the ninth Exhibition of Shunyokai.
In 1931, he submitted 'Gado-shita no supaku' (spark under a railroad bridge) (wood-block printing) to the ninth Exhibition of Shunyokai.
sen.cmt: 説明括弧を' 'の外に出しました。

sen.j: 第1回日本版画協会展に「請地の夜」（木版）を出品
sen.e: He submitted 'Ukechi no Yoru (Night in Ukechi)' (wood-block printing) to the first exhibition of the Japan Print Association.
He submitted 'Ukechi no Yoru (Night in Ukechi)' (wood-block printing) to the first exhibition of the Japan Print Association.
He submitted 'Ukechi no Yoru' (Night in Ukechi) (wood-block printing) to the first exhibition of the Japan Print Association.
sen.cmt: 説明括弧を' 'の外に出しました。

sen.j: 1932年（昭和7年） 小野忠重氏宅で開かれた新版画集団創立打ち合わせ会に出席、機関誌「新版画」第１号に「自画像」（木版）を発表
sen.e: In 1932, he attended a meeting for founding a new group of woodblock artists held at the house of Tadashige ONO, and released his 'Self-Portrait' (wood-block printing) in the Journal 'Shin Hanga (New woodblock print)' issue 1.

In 1932, he attended a meeting for founding a new group of woodblock artists held at the house of Tadashige ONO, and released his 'Self-Portrait' (wood-block printing) in the Journal 'Shin Hanga (New woodblock print)' issue 1.

sen.j: 1933年（昭和8年） 第14回帝展に、「給油所」（木版）を出品し入選
sen.e: In 1933, he submitted 'Kyuyujo (a fuel depot)' (wood-block printing) to the fourteenth Japan Art Academy Exhibition (Teiten) and the printing was selected.
In 1933, he submitted 'Kyuyujo (a fuel depot)' (wood-block printing) to the fourteenth Japan Art Academy Exhibition (Teiten) and the printing was selected.
In 1933, he submitted 'Kyuyujo' (a fuel depot) (wood-block printing) to the fourteenth Japan Art Academy Exhibition (Teiten) and the printing was selected.
sen.cmt: 説明括弧を' 'の外に出しました。

sen.j: 1934年（昭和9年） 館林に帰郷し城沼を絵巻風に描く
sen.e: In 1934, he went home in Tatebayashi, and drawn Jonuma (Jo marsh) like a picture scroll.
In 1934, he went home in Tatebayashi, and drawn Jonuma (Jo marsh) like a picture scroll.
In 1934, he went home in Tatebayashi, and drawn Jonuma (Jo marsh) like a picture scroll.

sen.j: 1935年（昭和10年） この年、「隅田川絵巻」全巻を完成。
sen.e: In 1935, he completed the whole set of volumes of 'picture scroll of the Sumida River'.
In 1935, he completed the whole set of volumes of 'picture scroll of the Sumida River'.
In 1935, he completed the whole set of volumes of 'picture scroll of the Sumida River.'
sen.cmt: ピリオド位置を訂正しました。

sen.j: 貧困と過労からノイローゼ
sen.e: He suffered from neurosis caused by poverty and overwork.
He suffered from neurosis caused by poverty and overwork.
He suffered from neurosis caused by poverty and overwork.

sen.j: 4月 「時代に生きよ、時代を超えよ」（エッセイ）、「白鬚橋」（木版）を発表
sen.e: In April, he released 'Jidai ni ikiyo, Jidai wo koeyo (Keep up with the times, Be ahead of the times)' (essay) and 'Shirahige Bashi (Shirahige Bridge)' (wood-block printing).
In April, he released 'Jidai ni ikiyo, Jidai wo koeyo (Keep up with the times, Be ahead of the times)' (essay) and 'Shirahige Bashi (Shirahige Bridge)' (wood-block printing).

sen.j: 6月 東京神田 (千代田区)の東京堂画廊で個展を開催
sen.e: In June, he held a one-man show at the Tokyo-Do gallery in Kanda, Tokyo (Chiyoda Ward).
In June, he held a one-man show at the Tokyo-Do gallery in Kanda, Tokyo (Chiyoda Ward).
In June, he held a one-man show at the Tokyo-Do gallery in Kanda, Tokyo (Chiyoda Ward).

sen.j: 9月 向島の小野忠重氏を訪ね、版画作品を贈り、「浅草小島町の姉方に行く」と言い残したまま失踪。
sen.e: In September, he visited Tadashige ONO in Mukojima and presented his wood-block printing to ONO, mentioning that he was going to visit his elder sister's house in Asakusa Kojima-cho and disappeared.
In September, he visited Tadashige ONO in Mukojima and presented his wood-block printing to ONO, mentioning that he was going to visit his elder sister's house in Asakusa Kojima-cho and disappeared.
In September, he visited Tadashige ONO in Mukojima and presented his wood-block printing to Ono, mentioning that he was going to visit his elder sister's house in Asakusa Kojima-cho and disappeared.
He was 24 years old.
